thread.title: Child victim of drive-by shooting on East Side dies of wounds, police say
thread.title_full: Child victim of drive-by shooting on East Side dies of wounds, police say | cleveland.com

author: Cliff Pinckard, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Child victim of drive-by shooting on East Side dies of wounds, police say
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A 3-year-old boy wounded in a drive-by shooting Tuesday night has died of his injuries, police said early Wednesday morning.
The boy, who has not been identified, was pronounced dead at MetroHealth Medical Center after surgery, according to a news release from Cleveland police.
The boy was one of two people shot Tuesday while sitting in a car on East 113th Street, between Union and Regalia avenues, at about 7:15 p.m.
According to police, the boy and a 24-year-old woman were passengers in a vehicle with a male driver. Witnesses tell police another vehicle pulled up to the car and someone inside began firing.
The woman in the car was struck once in the thigh, while the toddler was struck once in the chest.
The male in the car drove to the Cleveland Clinic, and the woman and toddler were then flown by helicopter to MetroHealth Medical Center.
The condition of the woman, who is not the child's mother, is unknown.
Witnesses told police that the second vehicle is a light-colored four-door sedan, possibly a Toyota.
Less than two weeks ago, on Sept. 4, 5-year-old Ramon Burnett was shot and killed while playing football in a small courtyard behind his grandmother's home on Louise Harris Drive in Cleveland's Central neighborhood.
Marlon Hackett, Jr., 19, and Dontavious Williams, 18, have been charged with aggravated murder in connection with Ramon's death. They are both being held on $1 million bond.
